Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2010 09:44AM joyko wrote: So happy that you got good news, Shellbell74!!!  That gives me hope as I am about to go for my biopsy in 1/2 hours.  Docs have basically indicated that they don't think mine is benign ... but I am happy for you and all those out there who get such wonderful news!!  Who knows....maybe I will be lucky too!!!
Posts.Title: The Waiting Game shellbell74 shellbell74

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 01:37PM joyko wrote: Laura and Nancy - Reading your posts has me crying!!!  It's like the flood gates opened - I've been trying to hold it in all day!  I am not even in your boat - yet!  My biopsy is tomorrow ... and then I will begin the waiting game that you (unfortunately) are playing now.   I, too, have my mind focusing on my sons (all teenagers) - and how to even tell them if this does end up being cancer.  So many scary thoughts to deal with --- and although I put on a good front - this board helps me in coping.  There are so many unbelievable women on here --- praying for us and sending us good wishes -- they are the true heroes after what they have been through.  I hope you both get good news ... and SOON!  Thanks for listening to me!
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2010 08:44AM joyko wrote: ac295206... I am hoping and praying that your results will be B9!!!  Try (key word - TRY) to keep your mind occupied with other things during this waiting period .... we have all been there - so we know how unnerving it can be!   ((((hugs)))))
Posts.Title: scared hopeful34 dlb823

Posts.Content: joyko wrote: I am 4 weeks (tomorrow) post-op from my rt mx... and I need some help.   During the operation, the PS put in 40cc of saline - and I won't get my next fill until next week.   The nurse at the PS's office said my TE sits high - and I am freaking out now about how this is going to be when I get more saline in it?  She said not to worry --- all will be fine with the exchange.  In the meantime - this 'thing' is going to grow bigger over the next several weeks -- how am I going to camouflage this 'growth' (haha!) coming out near my collarbone? Seriously - I was hoping that there might be some sites where I could see some pics of others with their TEs ... so that I don't feel totally alone with this.  If the TE was lower, it would be great because it would be looking more and more like a breast. Any sites that you know of?  Many thanks.... Dx 2/22/2010, DCIS, 4cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: These %$@* TEs! joyko mawhinney

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2010 06:00PM joyko wrote: Rosemary - I, too, know how hard it is to wait for the biopsy --- especially after the doc indicates that he/she thinks it is not benign.   Having just gone through this myself this month .... be happy that you found this board and the wonderful, compassionate ladies who will help you through this.  I will say a prayer tonight for you ... and I do hope that all goes well with the biopsy.  Try to relax - easier said than done - but truly, try to take some deep breaths and know that what will be, will be ...but that you WILL get through it!!!  Much love to you! Joyce

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 05:09AM joyko wrote: I had a large area of microcalcifications - and I was also told to get a stereotactic done.  My surgeon took various samples.  Did your doc mention how many samples he took?  I know it is hard to stay calm ... but do try.  Many of these turn out to be benign.   I am hoping you hear wonderful news soon ....  B9!!!      ((((hugs)))))

Posts.Content: joyko wrote: I am leaving now for the consult with the cardiologist re my abnormal EKG last week.  Please pray that all is well --- and my mx can still take place tomorrow! Hugs, J  Dx 2/22/2010, DCIS, 4cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Off to the Cardiologist - Wish me Luck! joyko nancyjg

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2010 03:44PM joyko wrote: Thanks, Somanywomen!!!  I got the go-ahead for tomorrow!  The doc gave me another EKG, and said it was showing a prior heart attack from the reading. (another shock to my system!)   He then checked me over, blood pressure was actually the lowest it has been for awhile throughout all this mess --- and then he said he wanted to do an echo to calm me down.  He felt the reading was a false positive ... and he said with the echo, he could look at the heart and see if there was any prior attack. So....the echo came back good --- all was fine with my heart -- no signs of a prior heart attack!  Whew!!!  Thank God!!!  My surgery is on for tomorrow -- now I am just waiting for the hospital to call with the time.
Posts.Title: Off to the Cardiologist - Wish me Luck! joyko nancyjg

Thanks...  Dx 2/22/2010, DCIS, 4cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: joyko wrote: I had my drain removed yesterday (no complaining about that!) - but now, where the tube exited from my underarm, it hurts -- kind of like a pinching.   I'm not sure why -- so I wanted to see if anyone else experienced this after removal of drains.    Also - with the TE - does it come around the side of your body?  When I took of the dressing from the drain site this morning, I was feeling around at all the wierdness (haha) in that area - and there was an area that felt hard.   This is all sooooo new .... and foreign!! Thanks in advance for your help!  Dx 2/22/2010, DCIS, 4cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ouch! joyko joyko

Posts.Content: joyko wrote: Finally!!!!  It has been 5 days since my biopsy -- and I was becoming more and more nervous as the days went by.  The BS called this afternoon - I have DCIS (stage 0, ER/PR +, grade 3).  Although I would have loved to hear it was benign ... I hoped that if I had to have 'something' -- it would be this.  I thank all of you wonderful ladies for your support over these past few weeks --- you are truly a remarkable bunch of women.  Although I would rather not have been here on this site --- it has truly changed my life...not just from the physical angle, but emotionally as well.  Reading all of your stories - and hearing from so many of you - has opened up a new chapter in my life.  I will now be going to the 'just diagnosed' forum...but I will continue to check in here and (hopefully) provide support to the women who follow me in this journey.  God bless all of you. Dx 2/22/2010, DCIS, 4cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The Waiting Has Ended... joyko Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2010 09:28PM joyko wrote: Hi, April Ladies!!!  I am one of the March Mx Ladies ... had my rt mx on Tuesday (30th) and came home this afternoon!  I feel wonderful, all things considered!  Time leading up to the surgery is so stressful --- and once that surgery is over, things start coming together and life is good.  Not too much pain for me --- mainly at the drain site --- and thankfully, I only have ONE drain!  Yea!  Otherwise, it is all do-able ...even the drain.  Keep on top of the pain meds after surgery - and you will be feeling fine.  I did the immediate reconstruction with TEs, so I can't speak for ladies having DIEP or other surgeries for reconstruction. Good luck to all of you ---- you will get through it and it will soon be summer!!! Hugs to all. Joyko
